definition: to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to push up one's sleeves
lit. to push up one's sleeves and bare one's fists/to be eager to get started
lit. to stroke the tiger's whiskers/to do sth very daring
to push up one's sleeves

sentences.english: He stopped and chuckled as he tugged at his gray goatee .
sentences.chinese: 说到这里他停了下来，捋着山羊胡子格格地笑着。

sentences.english: We'd better get everything straight before taking any action.
sentences.chinese: 我们最好把所有相关事宜都捋顺再采取行动。

sentences.english: I became just a little uncomfortable as he tucked the lock behind my ear.
sentences.chinese: 当他捋平我耳后的一缕头发时，我开始有些不安起来。

sentences.english: Well, let's clean this up slightly.
sentences.chinese: 好的，让我们再捋顺一点。

sentences.english: Fellowes stroked his little ginger moustache.
sentences.chinese: 费洛斯捋了捋他的姜黄色的胡须。

sentences.english: To be under arms stroking with lumbar rotation curve is still going.
sentences.chinese: 两臂下捋须随腰旋转，仍走弧线。

sentences.english: Tom bearded the lion in its den.
She folded the piece of paper, put it away, stood up, and smoothed her skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她把那张纸叠上，整理好，站起身来，捋下裙子。

sentences.english: He stroked down his hair and went.
The next stroke, the upper body can not forward, not protruding buttocks.
sentences.chinese: 下捋时，上体不可前倾，臀部不要凸出。
